org.nlpcraft.model

Interface NCToken

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface NCToken
extends Serializable
    A token is a part of a fully parsed user input. A token corresponds to a one or more words, sequential or not, in the user sentence and can be of two types:
    • System defined token that represents a built-in element whose ID starts with nlp:, e.g. nlp:num, nlp:geo.
    • User defined token that represent a detected user defined element in the model (see NCModel.getElements()).
    Most of the token's information is stored in a map-like metadata accessible via getMetadata() method. Depending on the ID of the token metadata will contain different properties. Some properties are common across all tokens. Consult getMetadata() method for detailed explanation. Note that class NCTokenUtils provides utility accessors to all metadata properties returned by getMetadata() method in a more convenient way.
    See Also:
    NCTokenUtils

    • Method Detail

      • getMetadata

        NCMetadata getMetadata()
        Gets token metadata.

        When a token is detected in the user input it has number of properties describing that token. These properties are stored in a map-like metadata interface for better future extensibility and API compatibility. Note that certain metadata is common across all types of tokens, while other parameters are specific to the particular types of built-in token. Note also that class NCTokenUtils provide convenient typed accessors to these properties as well as many utility methods.

        Intent DSL
        All token properties documented in this method can be used in NCIntentSolver.RULE DSL. Using token properties in intent definition may allow for better accuracy and deeper matching semantics for intents. For example: 
              new RULE("~GEO_KIND == CITY"); // Match only cities.
      new RULE("~NUM_INDEX != null"); // Avoid "dangling" numeric conditions.
      new RULE("~NUM_TO >= 100"); // Match any numeric values >= 100.
        Consult NCIntentSolver.RULE class for details.

        Common Properties
        The following metadata properties are provided for every token regardless of the type:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type
        NLP_UNID Internal globally unique system ID of the token. String
        NLP_BRACKETED Whether or not this token is surrounded by any of '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')' brackets. Boolean
        NLP_FREEWORD Whether or not this token represents a free word. A free word is a token that was detected neither as a part of user defined or system tokens, i.e. it has token ID nlp:nlp. Boolean
        NLP_DIRECT Whether or not this token was matched on direct (nor permutated) synonym. Boolean
        NLP_ENGLISH Whether this token represents an English word. Note that this only checks that token's text consists of characters of English alphabet, i.e. the text doesn't have to be necessary a known valid English word. See NCModel.isNonEnglishAllowed() for corresponding model configuration. Boolean
        NLP_LEMMA Lemma of this token, i.e. a canonical form of this word. Note that stemming and lemmatization allow to reduce inflectional forms and sometimes derivationally related forms of a word to a common base form. Lemmatization refers to the use of a vocabulary and morphological analysis of words, normally aiming to remove inflectional endings only and to return the base or dictionary form of a word, which is known as the lemma. Learn more at https://nlp.stanford.edu/IR-book/html/htmledition/stemming-and-lemmatization-1.html String
        NLP_STEM Stem of this token. Note that stemming and lemmatization allow to reduce inflectional forms and sometimes derivationally related forms of a word to a common base form. Unlike lemma, stemming is a basic heuristic process that chops off the ends of words in the hope of achieving this goal correctly most of the time, and often includes the removal of derivational affixes. Learn more at https://nlp.stanford.edu/IR-book/html/htmledition/stemming-and-lemmatization-1.html String
        NLP_POS Penn Treebank POS tag for this token. Note that additionally to standard Penn Treebank POS tags NLPCraft introduced '---' synthetic tag to indicate a POS tag for multiword tokens. Learn more at http://www.ling.upenn.edu/courses/Fall_2003/ling001/penn_treebank_pos.html String
        NLP_POSDESC Description of Penn Treebank POS tag. Learn more at http://www.ling.upenn.edu/courses/Fall_2003/ling001/penn_treebank_pos.html String
        NLP_SWEAR Whether or not this token is a swear word. NLPCraft has built-in list of common English swear words. See NCModel.isSwearWordsAllowed() for corresponding model configuration. Boolean
        NLP_ORIGTEXT Original user input text for this token. String
        NLP_NORMTEXT Normalized user input text for this token. String
        NLP_SPARSITY Numeric value of how sparse the token is. Sparsity zero means that all individual words in the token follow each other. Integer
        NLP_MININDEX Index of the first word in this token. Note that token may not be contiguous. Integer
        NLP_MAXINDEX Index of the last word in this token. Note that token may not be contiguous. Integer
        NLP_WORDINDEXES List of original word indexes in this token. Note that a token can have words that are not contiguous in the original sentence. Always has at least one element in it. List
        NLP_WORDLENGTH Number of individual words in this token. Equal to the size of NLP_WORDINDEXES list. Integer
        NLP_CONTIGUOUS Whether or not this token has zero sparsity, i.e. consists of contiguous words. Boolean
        NLP_START Start character index of this token. Integer
        NLP_END End character index of this token. Integer
        NLP_INDEX Index of this token in the sentence. Integer
        NLP_CHARLENGTH Character length of this token. Integer
        NLP_QUOTED Whether or not this token is surrounded by single or double quotes. Boolean
        NLP_STOPWORD Whether or not this token is a stopword. Stopwords are some extremely common words which add little value in helping understanding user input and are excluded from the processing entirely. For example, words like a, the, can, of, about, over, etc. are typical stopwords in English. NLPCraft has built-in set of stopwords.

        See NCModel.getAdditionalStopWords() and NCModel.getExcludedStopWords() methods for corresponding model configuration.         		Boolean
        NLP_NOTETYPE System type name of the token. String
        NLP_DICT Whether or not this token is found in Princeton WordNet database. Boolean


        Properties For nlp:geo Tokens
        nlp:geo system tokens represent geographical locations such as continents, countries, regions, cities, and metro areas. The following metadata properties are specifically provided for nlp:geo tokens:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type Optional
        GEO_KIND Kind of geographical location:
        • CONTINENT
        • SUBCONTINENT
        • COUNTRY
        • METRO
        • REGION
        • CITY
        		 String No
        GEO_CONTINENT Name of the continent. String No
        GEO_SUBCONTINENT Name of the subcontinent. String No
        GEO_COUNTRY Name of the continent. String Yes
        GEO_REGION Name of the region. String Yes
        GEO_CITY Name of the city. String Yes
        GEO_METRO Name of the metro area. String Yes
        GEO_LATITUDE Optional latitude of the location. Double Yes
        GEO_LONGITUDE Optional longitude of the location. Double Yes


        Properties For nlp:date Tokens
        nlp:date tokens represent a datetime range, i.e. two datetime points. The following metadata properties are specifically provided for nlp:date tokens:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type Optional
        DATE_FROM Start timestamp of the datetime range. Long No
        DATE_TO End timestamp of the datetime range. Long No


        Properties For nlp:num Tokens
        nlp:num tokens represent a single numeric value, a numeric range, or a numeric condition. All numeric values can have optional units. The following metadata properties are specifically provided for nlp:num tokens:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type Optional
        NUM_FROM Start of numeric range that satisfies the condition (exclusive). Note that if NUM_FROM and NUM_TO are the same this token represent a single value (whole or fractional) in which case NUM_ISEQUALCONDITION will be true. Double No
        NUM_FROMINCL Whether or not start of the numeric range is inclusive. Boolean No
        NUM_TO End of numeric range that satisfies the condition (exclusive). Note that if NUM_FROM and NUM_TO are the same this token represent a single value (whole or fractional) in which case NUM_ISEQUALCONDITION will be true. Double No
        NUM_TOINCL Whether or not end of the numeric range is inclusive. Boolean No
        NUM_ISEQUALCONDITION Whether this is an equality condition. Note that single numeric values (when NUM_FROM and NUM_TO are the same) also default to equality condition. Boolean No
        NUM_ISNOTEQUALCONDITION Whether this is a not-equality condition. Boolean No
        NUM_ISFROMNEGATIVEINFINITY Whether this range is from negative infinity. Boolean No
        NUM_ISRANGECONDITION Whether this is a range condition. Boolean No
        NUM_ISTOPOSITIVEINFINITY Whether this range is to positive infinity. Boolean No
        NUM_ISFRACTIONAL Whether this token's value (single numeric value of a range) is a whole or a fractional number. Boolean No
        NUM_INDEX Index of another token in the sentence that this numeric condition is referring to. If index could not be determined this token refers to a free word or a stopword. Integer Yes
        NUM_UNIT Optional numeric value unit (e.g. "mm", "cm", "ft"). See NUM_UNITTYPE for specific values of units and unit types. String Yes
        NUM_UNITTYPE Optional type of the numeric value unit (e.g. "length", "force", "mass"):
        NUM_UNITTYPE NUM_UNIT
        mass feet per second, grams, kilogram, grain, dram, ounce, pound, hundredweight, ton, tonne, slug
        torque newton meter
        area square meter, acre, are, hectare, square inches, square feet, square yards, square miles
        paper quantity paper bale
        force kilopond, pond
        pressure pounds per square inch
        solid angle steradian
        pressure, stress pascal
        luminous flux lumen
        amount of substance mole
        luminance candela per square metre
        angle radian, degree
        magnetic flux density, magnetic field tesla
        power, radiant flux watt
        datetime second, minute, hour, day, week, month, year
        electrical inductance henry
        electric charge coulomb
        temperature kelvin, centigrade, fahrenheit
        voltage, electrical volt
        momentum kilogram meters per second
        amount of heat calorie
        electrical capacitance farad
        radioactive decay becquerel
        electrical conductance siemens
        luminous intensity candela
        work, energy joule
        quantities dozen
        density density
        sound decibel
        electrical resistance, impedence ohm
        force, weight newton
        light quantity lumen seconds
        length meter, millimeter, centimeter, decimeter, kilometer, astronomical unit, light year, parsec, inch, foot, yard, mile, nautical mile
        refractive index diopter
        frequency hertz, angular frequency
        power kilowatt, horsepower, bar
        magnetic flux weber
        current ampere
        acceleration of gravity gravity imperial, gravity metric
        volume cubic meter, liter, milliliter, centiliter, deciliter, hectoliter, cubic inch, cubic foot, cubic yard, acre-foot, teaspoon, tablespoon, fluid ounce, cup, gill, pint, quart, gallon
        speed miles per hour, meters per second
        illuminance lux
        		String Yes


        Properties For nlp:function Tokens
        nlp:function tokens represent a function in relation to another token or tokens. The following metadata properties are specifically provided for nlp:function tokens:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type Optional
        FUNCTION_TYPE Type of the function detected. One of the following:
        • SUM - sum of some elements.
        • MAX - maximum of some elements.
        • MIN - minimum of some elements.
        • AVG - average of some elements.
        • SORT - sorting or ordering instruction over some elements.
        • LIMIT - range limit over some elements.
        • GROUP - grouping over some elements.
        • CORRELATION - correlation between two elements.
        • COMPARE - comparison between some elements.
        		 String No
        FUNCTION_INDEXES Indexes of the element(s) this token is referencing. Can be empty. List No
        FUNCTION_LIMIT Applicable only for LIMIT type. Limit value. Integer No
        FUNCTION_ASC Applicable only for LIMIT and SORT types. Whether limit or sort direction is ascending (bottom to top) or descending (top to bottom). Boolean No


        Properties For nlp:coordinate Tokens
        nlp:coordinate tokens geographical latitude and longitude coordinates. The following metadata properties are specifically provided for nlp:coordinate tokens:
        Name (Map Key) Description Value Type Optional
        COORDINATE_LATITUDE Coordinate latitude. Double No
        COORDINATE_LONGITUDE Coordinate longitude. Double No
        Returns:
        Token metadata.
        See Also:
        NCTokenUtils, getElementMetadata()

      • getElementMetadata

        NCMetadata getElementMetadata()
        Gets model element metadata when this token corresponds to the user element. Don't confuse this method with getMetadata() that returns properties for this token vs. the metadata for the model element this token is referring to. If this token is a system-defined one this method will return null.

        Intent DSL
        All properties returned by this method can be used in NCIntentSolver.RULE DSL. Using model element properties in intent definition may allow for better accuracy and deeper matching semantics for intents. For example: 
              new RULE("~MY_PROP == VALUE");
      new RULE("~INT_PROP != 100");
        Returns:
        Model element metadata when this token corresponds to the user element or null otherwise.
        See Also:
        NCElement.getMetadata(), getMetadata()

      • isUserDefined

        boolean isUserDefined()
        Checks whether or not this token represents a user defined model element (vs. a built-in system token).
        Returns:
        True if this token represents user-defined model element.

      • isSystemDefined

        boolean isSystemDefined()
        Checks whether or not this token represents a built-in system token.
        Returns:
        True if this token represents built-in system token.

      • getServerRequestId

        String getServerRequestId()
        Gets ID of the server request this token is part of.
        Returns:
        ID of the server request this token is part of.

      • getId

        String getId()
        If this token represents user defined model element this method returns the ID of that element. Otherwise, it returns ID of the built-in system token starting with nlp:. Note that a sentence can have multiple tokens with the same element ID. Don't confuse this ID with the internal system ID of the token itself accessible through NLP_ID metadata property.
        Returns:
        ID of the element (system or user defined).
        See Also:
        NCElement.getId(), getMetadata()

      • getParentId

        String getParentId()
        Gets the optional parent ID of the model element this token represents. This only available for user-defined model elements (system built-in tokens do not have parents).
        Returns:
        ID of the token's element immediate parent or null if not available.
        See Also:
        NCElement.getParentId()

      • getValue

        String getValue()
        Gets the value if this token was detected via element's value (or its synonyms). Otherwise returns null. Only applicable for user-defined model elements (system built-in tokens do not have values).
        Returns:
        Value for the user-defined model element or null, if not available.
        See Also:
        NCElement.getValues()

      • getGroup

        String getGroup()
        Gets optional group this token's element belongs to. Only applicable for user-defined model elements (system built-in tokens will return null).
        Returns:
        Element group or null if group is not available.
        See Also:
        NCElement.getGroup()
